bibl.title: Letter from A.S. von Mansfelde to Mabel H. Lazear, December 5, 1907

div1.p: Von Mansfelde writes about his work to increase Mabel Lazear's pension.

div1.head: Letter from A.S. von Mansfelde to Mabel H. Lazear, December 5, 1907
div1.opener:
No. 2768.
Nebraska State Medical Association
A. S. v. Mansfelde, M. D., Treasurer
“Quality hill,” Ashland, Nebraska
December 5th 1907.
Dear Mrs Lazear:
div1.p:
The Council of the A.M.A. meets
at Chicago, December 10th to 12th inlus, in-
stead of at Washington. I will write you
again after that meeting. Just now only a
line to say that my Congressman, Hon E.
H. Hinshaw, has made good by introdu-
cing a bill in the House for you - of 125
dollars a month pension - on December
3rd the second day of the session - and I
have word through Mr Thomas C. Lazear
that Senator Knox has accepted> and
will introduce a bill, identical with the
House bill (Mr Hinshaw will, or has already
furnished it to him), in the Senate, if he
has not already done so. The New York
Merchants Ass. are right with me and I
am sure The Council of The A.M.A. will be.
I trust that the very propitious beginning will
be followed by a successful ending.
div1.closer:
Most sincerely your friend ASvMansfelde. turn!
Mr Lazear is proving himself a splendid
help and he has promised to exert him-
self with persons as soon as I say
the word, which also for you will come
as soon as the bills are in committee
and the Amer. Med. Ass has asked
then the N.Y. Mercht's Ass. also will
be ready to jump into the arena.
You certainly have luck in your champions, always excepting poor
old me.
Again Yours.
ASvM.
